job.title: Associate Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: <strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>Builds &amp; maintains machine learning and big data pipelines to support advanced analytics, data science, and AI/ML solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Assists in development of software that processes, stores and serves data and machine learning models for use by others.</li><li> Assists in development of data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data that helps generate insights and intelligence to support business needs.</li><li> Writes ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) or ELT processes, designs data stores and develops tools for real-time and offline analytic processing on premise or on cloud infrastructure.</li><li> Assists in development of data and ML pipelines that are scalable, repeatable and secure</li><li> Assists in troubleshooting software and processes for data consistency and integrity. Integrates data from a variety of sources, assuring that they adhere to data quality and accessibility standards.</li><li> Escalates problems and roadblocks as they occur</li><li> Interacts with team members and peers and may interact with external peers to provide semi-routine information related to assigned tasks.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Experience establishing and maintaining key relationships with internal (peers, business partners and leadership) and external (business community, clients and vendors) within a matrix organization to ensure quality standards for service.</li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of SQL or programming skills in one or more of the following: Python, C, C++, Spark, Scala, and/or Java</li><li>Exposure to Azure</li></ul>
